page.title: 04BARLASTON -BUILDINGS
page.content: { Housing}is varied. From 'The Lea' estate (which dates back to the 1300's),through 19th century cottages to modern council houses and old people's bungalows,all properties are well kept and attractive. { Farms and smallholdings}possess open space and grazing land for contented sheep. There is one field for strawberry picking when in season. The largest{buildings}are :-the modern Barlaston First{School}of 150 pupils cradle of Fletcher Maths;the council{library}(housed in what was the old school house of the 1700's)the newly built parish{church}of St John the Baptist(erected in 1983); {Wedgewood Memorial College}(located in 'The Limes' a 19th century house in its own grounds);the Institute(Village Hall);Duke of York{public house}and the Barton Land{Old People's Home.
